leftvalue.name: Levelled
leftvalue.blurb: Those with higher Levelled scores believe that workplaces should be egalitarian, supporting worker ownership.

rightvalue.name: Stratified
rightvalue.blurb: Those with higher Stratified scores believe that workplaces should be stratified, supporting private property.

leftvalue.name: Usage
leftvalue.blurb: Those with higher Usage scores believe that land should be taxed, promoting land usage.

rightvalue.name: Rent
rightvalue.blurb: Those with higher Rent scores that land should not be taxed, promoting land ownership.

leftvalue.name: Needs
leftvalue.blurb: Those with higher Needs scores believe that the economy should be oriented towards the needs of population rather than the wants.

rightvalue.name: Demand
rightvalue.blurb: Those with higher Demand scores that the economy should be oriented towards the demand of population rather than the needs.

leftvalue.name: Central
leftvalue.blurb: Those with higher Central scores believe in a centrally-run economy.

rightvalue.name: Local
rightvalue.blurb: Those with higher Local scores believe in economy decentralization.

leftvalue.name: Automated
leftvalue.blurb: Those with higher Automated scores believe that the economy should prioritise the work of machines.

rightvalue.name: Employed
rightvalue.blurb: Those with higher Employed scores that the economy should prioritise the work of humans above machines.

leftvalue.name: National
leftvalue.blurb: Those with higher National scores believe that the economy should be closed off to the world.

rightvalue.name: Global
rightvalue.blurb: Those with higher Global scores believe that the economy should be open to the world.

rawtext.title: EconValues
rawtext.whatare12v_text: There are 6 independent axes - Structure, Land, Production, Control, Work and Trade - and each has two opposing values assigned to them:

instructiontext.title: EconValues
instructiontext.instructiontext: You will be presented with 24 statements. For each one, click the button with your opinion on it.
